p: Moisture content is of critical importance in food because it affects its physical properties, including taste, texture, appearance, and shelf life. Moisture and color of the flours obtained from both treated and untreated (negative control) grains are shown in Table 5. Results showed that the moisture of flours treated with essential oils showed no significant differences compared to the negative control within an accepted range of <14% [ 16]. Similarly, the color was not significantly altered by the essential oils, except the L* parameter of the flour obtained from grains treated with B. perfoliata essential oil, which gave more brilliance to the flour.
